overview: From 2025-12-15 to 2025-12-16, ethereum-optimism/optimism had 5 new PRs (6 merged), 6 new issues, and 28 active contributors.

topIssues.title: Remove deprecated OPCMv1 fields in ReadSuperchainDeployment script
topIssues.author: 0xniha
topIssues.body:
### Overview
Clean up deprecated fields that were used for OPCMv1 compatibility. These fields are no longer needed once OPCMv1 is fully deprecated.

### Fields to Remove

`OPCMAddress` field:
- `op-deployer/pkg/deployer/opcm/read_superchain_deployment.go` - Remove `OPCMAddress common.Address` field from struct.
- `op-deployer/pkg/deployer/pipeline/init.go` - Remove `OPCMAddress` handling.
- `packages/contracts-bedrock/scripts/deploy/ReadSuperchainDeployment.s.sol` - Remove `IOPContractsManager opcmAddress` field.

`ProtocolVersions` fields:
  - `op-deployer/pkg/deployer/opcm/read_superchain_deployment.go` - Remove `ProtocolVersions` fields.
  - `op-deployer/pkg/deployer/pipeline/init.go` - Remove `ProtocolVersions` handling.
  - `op-deployer/pkg/deployer/pipeline/init_test.go` - Remove `ProtocolVersions` test cases.
  - `packages/contracts-bedrock/scripts/deploy/ReadSuperchainDeployment.s.sol` - Remove `ProtocolVersions` fields.

topIssues.title: op-chain-ops: Update prove withdrawals script to use output roots for interop
topIssues.author: Inphi
topIssues.body: The `op-chain-ops/cmd/withdrawal` script contains a prove subcommand to allow users to prove withdrawals. Given the recent changes to the super DG, we no longer need a supervisor-rcp to prove withdrawals. Let's update the script to prove withdrawals for a specific output root that's contained in the super proposal.

topPRs.title: feat: add SuperFaultDisputeGameV2
topPRs.author: maurelian
topPRs.body:
## Summary

Implements SuperFaultDisputeGameV2 following the V2 architecture pattern established in PR #16929.

## Key Changes

### New Files
- **`src/dispute/v2/SuperFaultDisputeGameV2.sol`**: V2 implementation with CWIA helper functions
- **`interfaces/dispute/v2/ISuperFaultDisputeGameV2.sol`**: Interface for SuperFaultDisputeGameV2

### Modified Files
- **`src/libraries/DevFeatures.sol`**: Added `DEPLOY_V2_SUPER_DISPUTE_GAMES` feature flag
- **`test/dispute/SuperFaultDisputeGame.t.sol`**: Added `SuperFaultDisputeGameV2_Constructor_Test` with constructor validation and CWIA tests
- **`test/dispute/DisputeGameFactory.t.sol`**: Added `setupSuperFaultDisputeGameV2()` factory helpers

### Implementation Details

The V2 implementation follows the same CWIA (Clones With Immutable Arguments) pattern as FaultDisputeGameV2:
- Added `expectedInitCallDataLength()` helper returning `6 + immutableArgsByteCount()`
- Added `immutableArgsByteCount()` helper returning `244` (total CWIA bytes)
- Updated version from `0.6.0` to `0.7.0`
- All CWIA offsets remain unchanged (SuperFaultDisputeGame was already V2-compatible)
- Preserves all Super-specific features:
  - `l2SequenceNumber()` instead of `l2BlockNumber()`
  - `startingProposal()` instead of `startingOutputRoot()`
  - No `challengeRootL2Block()` function
  - Validates `l2ChainId` is zero in `initialize()`

### Testing

Added comprehensive tests following the FaultDisputeGameV2 pattern:
- Constructor parameter validation (max depth, split depth, clock extension)
- CWIA validation tests (extra/missing immutable args bytes)
- All tests feature-gated with `DEPLOY_V2_SUPER_DISPUTE_GAMES` flag

### Pre-PR Checks

All checks passing:
- ✓ Build successful
- ✓ All tests compile
- ✓ Interface validation
- ✓ Semver checks
- ✓ Code quality checks

## Test Plan

```bash
# Run V2 tests with feature flag enabled
DEV_FEATURE__DEPLOY_V2_SUPER_DISPUTE_GAMES=true forge test --match-contract SuperFaultDisputeGameV2
```

## Related

- Follows pattern from PR #16929 (FaultDisputeGame → FaultDisputeGameV2)
- Part of the broader V2 dispute game architecture

topPRs.title: op-node: Light CL: Always Follow Source using CL
topPRs.author: pcw109550
topPRs.body:
<!--
Contributions welcome! See https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

**Description**

Builds on top of https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/18365

This PR enables `--l2.follow.source` to only CL as the source. It also ingests external `CurrentL1` data into the CL. When using a CL RPC endpoint, we can fetch `CurrentL1` directly.

Populating `CurrentL1` is required for the batcher to operate correctly. Without derivation running, the `syncStatus.CurrentL1` field remains empty, which prevents the batcher and potentially other microservices from making progress.

Previous `--l2.unsafe-only` is dropped.

Sanity check all external info: SafeL2, FinalizedL2, CurrentL1 against Light CL's L1 Source. If those L1 blocks are not found, do not inject the info to the node.

**Tests**

Existing in memory acceptance preset was tweaked to follow CL.

Patched `TestFollowL2_Safe_Finalized_CurrentL1` to track that `CurrentL1` field is advancing and matching.

Drops all `unsafe_only` tests.

Drops all ext el tests since the light CL only follows the CL, not the EL.

Commit: https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/18571/commits/54f8d9b9ec6ad89a09b93912d80571b4158bc425 is running at the `changwan-0` devnet, with light CL sequencer as a leader(image: `54f8d9b-light-cl-follow-source-cl`).

**Metadata**

- Part of https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/issues/18317

topPRs.title: chore: Add SafeRename ioutil utility
topPRs.author: janjakubnanista
topPRs.body:
<!--
Contributions welcome! See https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

**Description**

We encountered a problem regarding the github release binary provider where a regular `os.Rename` would result in `invalid cross-device link` errors. These were caused by trying to rename a file across mounts/filesystems.

The new `SafeRename` tries `os.Rename` first, then falls back to copy & delete.

You might notice there are no tests currently - this is due to the lack of cross-platform support for mounting filesystems (which we need to run a full test) - neither `[k8s.io/utils/mount](https://pkg.go.dev/k8s.io/utils/mount)` nor `[github.com/moby/sys/mount](https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/moby/sys/mount)` have support for darwin.

Related to https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/platforms-team/issues/1119
